definitions.text: switch (a car's headlights) from a higher to a lower beam

examples: the lights dimmed and the curtain rose
Time had dimmed the silver

definitions.text: make dim by comparison or conceal

examples: The distinction between the two theories blurred

definitions.text: lacking in light; not bright or harsh
examples: a dim light beside the bed
subdued lights and soft music
a dim figure in the distance
only a faint recollection
shadowy figures in the gloom
saw a vague outline of a building through the fog
a few wispy memories of childhood
the dimmed houselights brought a hush of anticipation
dimmed headlights
we like dimmed lights when we have dinner

definitions.text: offering little or no hope; ; ; - J.M.Synge
examples: the future looked black
prospects were bleak
Life in the Aran Islands has always been bleak and difficult
took a dim view of things

definitions.text: slow to learn or understand; lacking intellectual acuity; ; ; - Thackeray
examples: so dense he never understands anything I say to him
never met anyone quite so dim
although dull at classical learning, at mathematics he was uncommonly quick
dumb officials make some really dumb decisions
he was either normally stupid or being deliberately obtuse
worked with the slow students
